text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The United States is determined to bring about a solution of the Cyprus problem soon.
- Greek ships, Mirages and F-16s will be on military exercise in Cyprus in early October, according to Greek newspaper report.
- Debate on whether the Akamas peninsula is to be turned into a national park is to go to the House of Representatives.
- Washington and its European partners push ahead with the idea of confidential talks to resolve the Cyprus problem.
- Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash sets new conditions for a solution. The right of return is not compatible with the principles of a bizonal, bicommunal federation, he says.
- Intensive consultations are expected to start on adopting a solution of the Cyprus problem with considerable territorial adjustments, loosely based on a federal system.
- Western diplomats put pressure on the government to suspend its armament programmes.
- Turkey is looking to a package deal on Cyprus involving simultaneous accession to the European Union, and to link the problem with Greek-Turkish disputes.
- Illegal hunters target the homes of game wardens.
- We accept peace, but not with a Turkish flag flying over us, says President Glafcos Clerides.
